statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -5 \\ -4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -2 \\ -1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 9 \\ 15 \\ 12 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -10 \\ -34 \\ -26 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -5 \\ -4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -2 \\ -1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 9 \\ 15 \\ 12 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -10 \\ -34 \\ -26 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4.
